thread.title: Despite wins, Gap, Lee drop in 2A East ratings
thread.title_full: Despite wins, Gap, Lee drop in 2A East ratings

title: Despite wins, Gap, Lee drop in 2A East ratings
text:
Despite wins, Gap, Lee drop in 2A East ratings Tom Jacobs , tjacobs@newsleader.com 4:37 p.m. EDT October 26, 2015 Riverheads' Garrett Campbell looks for running room as fullback Colt Miller provides the blocking during the Gladiators' win Friday night over Wilson Memorial. (Photo: Griffin Moores/The News Leader) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
A win isn't always a win when it comes to the VHSL's weekly football ratings. Just look at what happened to Buffalo Gap, Robert E. Lee and Stuarts Draft in this week's tabulations. 
The Bison and the Leemen posted big wins Friday, but fell one spot in the ratings to second and seventh, respectively, in 2A East. Stuarts Draft also won big, but fell from 10th to 12th, while Wilson Memorial fell from 14th to 15th after losing to Riverheads. 
There were no changes for the Gladiators and Waynesboro in their respective regions. The Red Pride remain atop 1A East, while the Little Giants remained at No. 10 in 3A West in the wake of their shutout win over Broadway. 
The ratings, which determine the teams in each region that will advanced to postseason play, are an average of points from a formula that includes opponentsâ€™ classification, in-district or out-of-district status, and wins and losses by teams already beaten or defeated. 
The top 16 teams in 2A East and 3A West go to the postseason, while the top 12 in 1A East make the postseason, with the top four teams receiving first-round byes. 
The Bison, who last week were tied with Clarke County for the top spot in 2A East, improved to 7-1 Friday with a 42-6 thrashing of Stonewall Jackson. Clarke County, of the Bull Run District, also won, beating winless Riverside 72-6. 
The result? Clarke County took sole possession of the top spot a 23.00 rating, while Gap fell to second at 22.75. 
In the case of the Leemen, who were sixth in 2A East last week, they moved to 5-3 Friday with an impressive 55-21 win over Spotswood. It was third straight win for Lee, which was 12th in the first 2A East ratings. 
However, the Leemen fell one spot in the ratings to seventh, while being leapfrogged by Washington & Lee (No. 5) and King William (No. 6) Washington & Lee beat Rappahannock 24-10, while King William crushed 1A team Middlesex 50-20. 
Stuarts Draft which was tied for 10th last week with Strasburg, rebounded from a tough loss to Wilson with a 57-14 pummeling of Page County on Friday. But the Cougars fell two spots, while Strasburg, an 8-7 winner over Madison County on Friday, fell to 11th, and Greensville, which knocked off 1A East power Franklin on Friday, moved from 12th to eighth. 
Wilson remains in good shape for a 2A East playoff spot, despite its 42-7 loss to Riverheads. The Green Hornets are in the 15th spot with a 16.25 rating, 1.25 points better than No. 16 Arcadia (15.00). 
The top five teams in 2A East this week are Clarke County, Buffalo Gap, Goochland, Amelia County and Washington & Lee. 
The Gladiators continued their run atop 1A East, earning a rating of 26.25. Essex, William Campbell and Franklin are the next three, while Rappahannock and Sussex Central are tied for fifth. 
In 3A West, Waynesboro maintained its 10th-place standing with a 21.11 rating, remaining ahead of No. 11 Blacksburg (20.5) and behind No. 9 Rustburg (22.25). The Little Giants play their final regular season game Friday against Fort Defiance and have a week off before the playoffs start. 
Weekly Rankings as of Oct. 26 
Group 2A East 
1. Clark County 23.00, 2. Buffalo Gap 22.75, 3. Goochland 22.43, 4. Amelia County 21.00, 5. Washington & Lee 20.75, 6. King William 20.63, 7. Robert E. Lee 20.38, 8. Greensville 19.50, 9. George Mason 19.14, 10. Brunswick 19.00, 11. Strasburg 18.63, 12. Stuarts Draft 18.38, 13. Central Woodstock 18.13, 14. East Rockingham 17.00, 15. Wilson Memorial 16.25 , 16. Arcadia 15.00. 
Group 1A East 
1. Riverheads 26.25, 2. Essex 24.88, 3. William Campbell 20.88, 4. Franklin 20.29, 5. (tie) Rappahannock and Sussex Central 19.75, 7. (tie) Luray and Central Lunenberg 18.63, 9. Altavista 17.63, 10. Lancaster 17.50, 11. Middlesex 16.63, 12. Mathews 14.75. 
Group 3A West 
1. Magna Vista 27,13, 2. Brookville 26.00, 3. Western Albemarle 25.88, 4. Northside 25.44, 5. Lord Botetourt 24.75, 6. Staunton River 24.00, 7. Abingdon 23.63, 8. Monticello 22.88, 9. Rustburg 22.25, 10. Waynesboro 21.11, 11. Blacksburg 20.50, 12. Turner Ashby 20.25, 13. Liberty Bedford 19.75, 14. Alleghany 18.11, 15. Heritage Lynchburg 17.75, 16, Broadway 17.38.
